alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:25AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Lawrence County through 230 AM EDT... At 123 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richville, moving northeast at 25 mph. These thunderstorms will produce a quick 1/2 to 1 inch of rainfall less than a half hour. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Gouverneur, Canton, Lisbon, De Kalb, Rensselaer Falls, Heuvelton, Morley, Waddington, Richville, Edwardsville, Hammond, Madrid, Chipman, Norwood, De Peyster, Pyrites, West Potsdam, De Kalb Junction, and North Gouverneur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
